_header: With sharp thorns that beth keen
Note: For other MSS see 6713; for the indulgence see 5196.
_description: The Wounds of Christ as Remedies against the Deadly Sins — eight quatrains

BodAsh61.Editions:
Shuffleton,  George. 
             Ashmole 61: A Compilation of Popular Middle English Verse.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008: 385-6; 575-9; 626.

CULEe513.First Lines:
þat þe scheding of cristis blodis a wasing of mannis
                    mod& not only þat of þingbut of svnder maner
                    begyning…
CULEe513.Last Lines:
…mi body was bllo qwan it was betenlere at me þi lustes
                    to leten
CULEe513.Note:
Seven stanzas; preceded by Latin equivalent, ‘Cristus lauit nos
                        a peccatis nostris in sanguine suo…’ (f.
                    15va).

CULFf238.First Lines:
Wyth scharpe þornes þat weren full keeneMyn hedd was
                    crowned ȝe moun well seeneThe blood ranne downe all be my
                    chekeThou prowde man þerfore be meke…
CULFf238.Last Lines:
…That te þese lessons ouyr wole redeAnd ther
                    with þer sowlys fede
CULFf238.Attributed Title:
The vii virtues contrarie to þe vii dedli synnes (f.
                    32vb)
CULFf238.Facsimiles:
McSparran,  Frances,  and  Pamela R. Robinson.  
             “Introduction.” 
             Cambridge University Library MS Ff.2.38.
         London: Scolar Press, 1979.

CamMagPep1584.First Lines:
With scharp thornys þat wer full keneMy hed was crownyd ye may
                    well seneThe blode Ran down all by my chekeThou proude man þerfor
                    be meke…
CamMagPep1584.Last Lines:
…That þeis lessons will ouyr RedeAnd þer with
                    þair soulis sede
CamMagPep1584.Note:
Rubric names of seven deadly sins above each stanza, e.g., ‘a gan
                    pride’, ‘a gayn wrothe’.
CamMagPep1584.Attributed Title:
Here sueth þe vii vertuous a gayn þe vii dedly synnys (f.
                        108v)

BLAdd37049.Editions:
Doty,  Brant Lee,
                        ed.  
             “An Edition of British Museum MS Additional 37049: a Religious
                Miscellany.” 
         Diss. Michigan State, 1969: 197-9.

BLHar2339.First Lines:
Wiþ scharpe þornes þat were ful keneMyn heed was
                    crowned ȝe moun wel sene…
BLHar2339.Last Lines:
…Þat þese lessouns ouer wole redeAnd
                    þerwiþ her soulis fede
BLHar2339.Attributed Title:
Þe vij virtues aȝens þe vij deedli synnes (rubricated, f.
                        117v)
BLHar2339.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XIV Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1924. 2nd ed., rev.: G. V. Smithers, Oxford,
            1952: 227-8.
Person,  Henry Axel. 
             Cambridge Middle English Lyrics.
         Seattle: University of Washington Press, 1953; rev. ed. 1962: 68-9.

Longleat30.First Lines:
With scharp thornes þat beth keneMy hede was crowned ye may
                    sene…
Longleat30.Last Lines:
…That this lesson euer wil redeAnd ther with her her soules
                    fede
